intro: Raddia fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered raddia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly serrated edge. Raddia fasciculata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
